Translations.Text: On the Day when every soul will come to plead for itself, every soul shall be paid what it has earned, and they shall not be wronged

Allah coins a similitude (parable): a city which was safe and content, its provision came to it in plenty from every place, and then it denied (was ungrateful for) AllahÂ´s favours, and Allah made it feel the garb of dearth and fear, because of that
And there came to them a messenger from amongst themselves, but they called him a liar, so the torment seized them, while yet they were unjust
Eat, then, from what Allah has provided you, things lawful and good, and give thanks for the favours of Allah, if it be Him you serve

He has only forbidden you carrion, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and that which is devoted to other than Allah; but he who is driven thereto (forced by necessity), neither craving nor transgressing due limits, then verily, Allah is Forgiving and Merc
And say not of what your own tongues pronounce, the lie "This is lawful, and this is unlawful," inventing against Allah a lie; verily, those who invent against Allah a lie shall not prosper
A brief enjoyment for them - then a grievous woe
For those who are Jews We have forbidden what We have already narrated to you. We wronged them not, but they were wont to wrong themselves
